ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn né Yelemî ngie:
en: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:

ngiemboon: «Yelemî, lu ssé! Cwóŋo mbʉ̀a mbwòontsǎʼ pɔ́ kwàʼ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn. Ɔ̀ ge gʉa tà kúu wó, e shwóŋo gú nò gie áa ssé.»
en: “Go down at once to the potter’s house;   there I will reveal my words to you.”

ngiemboon: N deen ńcwóŋo mbʉ̀a mbwòontsǎʼ, ńgyá á gwɔ́ jʉʼʉ fàʼ ńne ńdɔgɔ pàga peláŋ yé gie à lɔgɔ ḿbwóon mengwʉ̌ŋ éfaʼa.
en: So I went down to the potter’s house, and there he was, working away at the wheel.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ngwʉ̌ŋ gẅie à la ne ńdɔgɔ mbwó ńnyɛte, alɔ̌ʼ la kẅɛɛ mǒ, á gwɔ́ páʼ áa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ńkẅɛ púʼu. Á leen ńgwɔ́ púʼu, á gwoon ńgíŋe ńdwo ńnyɛte wetsɔ́ kwàʼ páʼ à ne ńkwoŋo.
en: But the jar that he was making from the clay became flawed in the potter’s hand, so he made it into another jar, as it seemed right for him to do.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie:
en: The word of the Lord came to me:

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, tsye n te kuʼu légÿo na pi páʼ wɔɔn mbwòontsǎʼ wɔ́ ka? Pi ee mbwó mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ tsǎʼ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ mbwó mbwòon ńgwɔ́. Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gɔɔn.
en: “House of Israel, can I not treat you as this potter treats his clay? ” #— #this is the Lord’s declaration. “Just like clay in the potter’s hand, so are you in my hand, house of Israel.

ngiemboon: Áa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, n ne ńgɔɔn nò, ńtí láʼ kà pɔ́ ngwòŋ wɔ́ɔ, ńkíme nò na léfó ssé ńtsɔ́ʼ, mbɔɔ létág, ńgÿo lépyág.
en: At one moment I might announce concerning a nation or a kingdom that I will uproot, tear down, and destroy it.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a wɛ̌ ngwòŋ lɔɔn ńgwáʼ mefʉ̌ʼ menò mie pɔ́ fʉʼʉ, mbà nò tepòŋ gie n kɔʼɔ́ gÿo na pɔ́b, n cʉ́ʼʉ gÿo wɔ́.
en: However, if that nation about which I have made the announcement turns from its evil, I will relent concerning the disaster I had planned to do to it.

ngiemboon: Ḿbiŋ ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, n ne ńgɔɔn nò, ńtí tsɔ́ láʼ kà tsɔ́ ngwòŋ wɔ́ɔ, ńkíme nò na legíŋe ńkwɛ́, ńgíŋe ḿbʉʼʉ ńtÿɔ́g.
en: At another time I might announce concerning a nation or a kingdom that I will build and plant it.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a wɛ̌ ngwòŋ lɔɔn te ncwò wɔ́ɔn júʼ, ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á té wɔ́ɔn poŋ, mbà nò mbòŋo gie n kaʼá légÿo na pɔ́b, n cʉ́ʼʉ gÿo wɔ́.
en: However, if it does what is evil in my sight by not listening to me, I will relent concerning the good I had said I would do to it.

ngiemboon: «Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, gù Yelemî; gɔɔn nò mbwó pʉ̀a Yúndà, mbɔɔ mbwó pʉ̀a pie é tsẅé Yelúzálèm. Ɔ̀ ge gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn ngie: N ka táŋte ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie n ge téme twó pi; n ne sáŋa menò ńtí gẅí. Mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie aa nùɔ pi gwáʼa tsẅé tepòŋ gie à gẅiin. Oon, pi gÿo ntí lenéŋè gẅi, pɔ́ ngÿǒ menò mí, e poŋ.
en: So now, say to the men of Judah and to the residents of Jerusalem, ‘This is what the Lord says: Look, I am about to bring harm to you and make plans against you. Turn now, each from your evil way, and correct your ways and your deeds.’

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Yɛ̂ te tsɔ́ nò wɔ́! Peg ge gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie peg ka zǎb, peg ge ké giŋ pɔ́ na menkwaŋá tepòŋ még.»
en: But they will say, ‘It’s hopeless.   We will continue to follow our plans, and each of us will continue to act according to the stubbornness of his evil heart.’ ”

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie:
en: Therefore, this is what the Lord says:

ngiemboon: Tsye gʉ́m aa páʼa ńcʉ́ʼʉ ḿbwoon metǒon mie
en: Does the snow of Lebanon ever leave the highland crags?

ngiemboon: Táʼ, epʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn kéen ńdege wɔ́ɔn.
en: Yet my people have forgotten me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kéen sele ngwòŋ wɔ́b,
en: They have made their land a horror,

ngiemboon: Ngàŋmbù ge gÿo tó,
en: I will scatter them before the enemy like the east wind.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pege gʉa! Yɔɔn áa fʉ̀ʼ gie ngwɔ́ pege lɔ́ɔn ncù Yelemî. Ńtí nue ngwɔ́ pege le zág panuŋepwɔʼ pie ngwɔ́ pɔ́ zíʼi wégè lepʉ̌ wɔ́, ńké le zág pazsénò pie ngwɔ́ pɔ́ náa wégè mentÿɔgɔ́ wɔ́, é ké le zág pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé pie ngwɔ́ pɔ́ shwóŋo wégè nò Ssé wɔ́. Pege gʉa ńdɔg meshwóŋè tepòŋ ńtágte yé. Ndyɛ̀ʼ pege zẅíʼte nò gie à ge gɔɔn.»
en: Then certain ones said, “Come, let’s make plans against Jeremiah,   for instruction will never be lost from the priest,  # 18:18 Jr 2:8,26; 5:31; 6:13; 8:10; 13:13; 23:11,33; Ezk 7:26; Mc 3:11; Zph 3:4 or counsel from the wise, or a word from the prophet.  # 18:18 Jr 5:13 Come, let’s denounce him  # 18:18 Lit let’s strike him with the tongue and pay no attention to all his words.”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, tʉ́ŋe tuŋó jú,
en: Pay attention to me, Lord.

ngiemboon: Tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé lɔgɔ nò tepòŋ, ńtsɔ́ʼɔ yembòŋo?
en: Should good be repaid with evil?

ngiemboon: Páʼ á gwɔ̌ páʼɔɔn la, á ne ńzɛ́te ɔ̀ gÿo penkʉ́ pɔ́b kwé nzyè.
en: Therefore, hand their children over to famine,

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie
en: Let a cry be heard from their houses

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgʉa na gù, mbà ɔ̀ ne ńzsé
en: But you, Lord, know
